description: Construction of part-three, part-four storey building to provide 15 self-contained residential units on upper floor levels and 254 sqm. of commercial retail space (Use Class A1) at ground floor level; with associated refuse storage, car parking, cycle parking and disabled parking (following demolition of building)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): 16001_GA X-01_Existingeresford Basement Level Plan, 16001_GA X.00_Existing Ground Floor Plan, 16001_GA X.01_Existing First Floor Plan, 16001_GA.00_Proposed Ground Floor Rev A, 16001_GA.01_Proposed First Floor, 16001_GA.02_Proposed Second Floor, 16001_GA.03_ Proposed Third Floor, 16001_GA.04_ Proposed Roof Level

16001_GE X.00_Existing Greenford Avenue Elevation, 16001_GE X.01_Existing Beresford Avenue Elevation, 16001_GE X.02_Existing Service Access Lane Elevation, 16001_GE.00_Proposed Greenford Avenue Elevation, 16001_GE.01_Proposed Beresford Avenue Elevation, 16001_GE.02_Proposed Service Access Lane Elevation, 16001_GS.00_Proposed Section A-A, 16001_GS.01_Proposed Section B-B, 16001_S.00 Site Location Plan, 16001_S.01 Proposed Site Plan.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Details of the materials and finishes to be used for all external surfaces (including hardstanding and boundary treatments) of the development hereby approved shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority before any part of the development is commenced and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials and finishes are of high quality and contribute positively to the visual amenity of the locality in accordance with policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2(h), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage, in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards, has been provided in an accessible location for flats and have been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, policy 7B of the Adopted Ealing Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policies 7.4, and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).

| Provision for cycle storage in accordance with adopted standards and as shown on approved plan  16001_GA.00_Proposed Ground Floor Rev A shall be provided prior to occupation of the units and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016).
| The development hereby approved shall comply with 'Secured by Design' standards.

Reason: To ensure that the development incorporates crime prevention measures to help prevent crime and disorder and to improve pedestrian accessibility in accordance with policies1.1 (e)(h) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7.3 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policy 7.3 of the London Plan (2016).
| The developer shall draw to the attention of the Local Planning Authority the presence of any unsuspected contamination encountered during the development.

In the event of contamination to land and/or water being encountered, no development shall continue until a programme of investigation and/or remedial work to include methods of monitoring and certification of such work undertaken has been submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

None of the development shall be occupied until the approved remedial works, monitoring and certification of the works have been carried out and a full validation report has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

In the event that no contamination is encountered, the developer shall provide a written statement to the Local Planning Authority confirming that this was the case, and only after written approval by the Local Planning Authority shall the development be occupied.

Reason: To ensure that any ground and water contamination is identified and adequately addressed to ensure the safety of the development, the environment and to ensure the site is suitable for the proposed use.
| The installation in each dwelling of an ultra-low NOx boiler with maximum NOx emissions of under 40 mg/kWh shall be completed prior to first occupation and thereafter permanently retained.
Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016).

| The development hereby approved must be provided with filtered fresh air ventilation system capable of mitigating elevated concentrations of nitrogen oxides in the external air. The ventilation system shall be completed prior to first occupation of the 15 no. self-contained residential units and shall be retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development in accordance with SPG10: Noise & Vibration, policies 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013), policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016) and National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the Local Planning Authority:
a.	Bedrooms (23.00-07.00 hrs) 30 dB LAeq and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
b.	Living rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 35 dB LAeq.
c.	Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first occupation of the 15 no. self-contained residential units and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013) and SPG10: Noise and Vibration.

| No development (including initial site clearance) shall commence until a detailed Demolition and Construction Management Plan has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The management plan must refer to the following matters:
a.	Removal of any earth from the site.
b.	Site clearance, demolition, excavation and construction methods.
c.	Site management and access.
d.	Signage for construction traffic, pedestrians and other users of the site.
e.	Prevention of mud and debris being deposited on Greenford Avenue, Beresford Avenue and surrounding areas.
f.	Vehicle and machinery specification.
g.	Turning manoeuvres and routeing of vehicles.
h.	Estimated number and frequency of vehicle deliveries.
i.	Parking of construction vehicles.
j.	Compliance with noise limits and vibration mitigation measures.
k.	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.
l.	Mitigation of air pollution and dust emissions on site during construction and operational works phases of the development.
m.	Waste management, hazardous material storage and removal.

Reason: To protect the amenity of occupants and neighbouring properties in accordance with policy 7A and policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (adopted 2013), policy 7.14 and policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012) and National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| BREEAM standards

The non-residential element of the development should be registered with Building Research Establishment (BRE), achieve BREEAM Rating Very Good as set out in BREEAM Pre-Assessment (February 2017) prepared by Greengage Environmental Ltd and make reasonable endeavours to achieve Excellent (based on the latest BREEAM NC Technical guidance).

i.	Within 3 months of completion of the non-residential element of the development, Interim BREEAM NC Assessment and related Certification verified by the BRE shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

ii.	Within 3 months from the date of first occupation of the non-residential element of the development, BREEAM 'Post Construction Stage' Assessment and related Certification verified by the BRE should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval confirming the BREEAM standard and measures have been implemented.

Following any approval of a 'Post Construction Stage' assessment and certificate of the development, the approved measures and technologies to achieve the BREEAM Very Good or higher standard shall be retained in working order for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan (2016), policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and policies 5.2 and 7A of  the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
| Sustainable Design and Construction Standards

Upon the first occupation of each element of the development, the approved development shall incorporate sustainability measures as detailed in the approved Sustainability and Energy Statement Rev 01 (February 2017) prepared by Greengage Environmental Ltd.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2016, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG, April 2014.
| Water Efficiency for dwellings

Prior to occupation of each dwelling proposed within the development, the approved dwellings shall incorporate and maintain water saving measures that will meet water efficiency standards with a maximum water use target of 105 litres of water per person per day.
Reason: To ensure the sustainable use of water, in accordance with policy 5.15 of the London Plan 2016.
| Overheating for dwellings

Prior to the first occupation of each dwelling within the development, the approved residential units shall incorporate and maintain mitigation measures that will assist with reducing the risk of overheating, follow the Cooling Hierarchy and comply with CIBSE TM49 & TM52 criteria as stated in the TM52 Overheating Assessment Rev 01 (August 2017) prepared by Greengage Environmental Ltd.

Reason: To ensure that the dwellings hereby approved are energy efficient and to reduce the risk of overheating in line with policy 5.9 of the London Plan 2016, adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (3rd April 2012) and Development Management DPD (December 2013).
| Overheating and Cooling for the commercial unit

Prior to occupation of the commercial element of the development, the details of the dynamic thermal modelling using the guidance and criteria provided in CIBSE TM49 & TM52 and demonstrating how this element of the development performs against and even exceed the overheating criteria, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval. The details of any additional measures to be incorporated into this element of the development to minimise the risk of overheating (without active cooling first) shall also be submitted and evidence that these measures can be incorporated into the development if the dynamic thermal modelling demonstrates that overheating would occur. The non-residential element of the development shall thereafter be provided in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the non-residential element of the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to reduce the risk of overheating in line with policy 5.9 of the London Plan 2016, adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (3rd April 2012) and Development Management DPD (December 2013).
| Energy Strategy for residential units

A) Within three-months of the practical completion of the residential element of the development, Energy Performance Certificates and detailed modelling output reports showing clearly the DER/TER from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

B) Within three-months of the practical completion of the residential element of the development, evidence that the renewable/low carbon technologies, if incorporated, are certified under the Microgeneration Certification Scheme (MSC) and, if appropriate, complies with the Enhanced Capital Allowances (ECS) product criteria should be submitted.

C) Prior to the final completion of the residential element of the development, the approved dwellings shall incorporate and maintain measures to achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 35% (equal to 6.1 tonnesCO2/yr) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 through the following carbon emission savings as detailed in the approved Sustainability and Energy Statement Rev 01 (February 2017) and Briefing Note FO2 (22 September 2017) and additional information (23 February 2018) prepared by Greengage Environmental Ltd:

o	energy saving measures and a combination of energy efficient gas boilers to provide space heating and hot water to achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 1.7 tonnes CO2 equating to 9.8% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the compliant BR Part L 2013 base case.

o	Installation of solar Photovoltaic system with a total panel area of at least 57 sq.m and capacity of at least 10kWp to supply at least 8.7MWh of electricity annually for the residential element of the development and achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 4.5 tonnes CO2 equating to 28.5% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the Be Lean case of the Energy Hierarchy.

D) Measures to reduce the carbon dioxide emissions associated with other energy uses not covered by Building Regulations (un-regulated) should be incorporated prior to occupation and maintained in the development in perpetuity as detailed in the Sustainability and Energy Statement Rev 01 (February 2017).
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.

Reason:  To ensure that the dwellings hereby approved are energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.
| Energy Strategy for commercial units

A) Six months prior to the practical completion of the development, technical details about the ASHP in line with GLA's planning guidance for preparing energy assessments, March 2016 and appendix B of Ealing energy statement guidance shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

B) Within three-months of the practical completion of the commercial element of the development, Energy Performance Certificates and detailed modelling output reports showing clearly the BER/TER from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

C) Within three-months of the practical completion of the commercial element of the development, evidence that the renewable/low carbon technologies, if incorporated, are certified under the Microgeneration Certification Scheme (MSC) and, if appropriate, complies with the Enhanced Capital Allowances (ECS) product criteria should be submitted.

D) Prior to the final completion of the commercial element of the development, the approved non-residential space shall incorporate and maintain measures to achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 35.1% (equal to 3.4 tonnesCO2/yr) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 through the following carbon emission savings as detailed in the approved Sustainability and Energy Statement Rev 01 (February 2017) and Briefing Note FO2 (17 May 2017 & 22 September 2017) prepared by Greengage Environmental Ltd:

o	energy saving measures and a combination of energy efficient gas boilers to provide space heating and hot water to achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 0.5 tonnes CO2 equating to 5.7% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the compliant BR Part L 2013 base case.

o	Installation of Air Source Heat Pump (ASHP) system with at least 3.5 Coefficient of Performance (CoP) and Energy Efficiency Ratio (EER) 3 to supply the space heating and cooling requirements of the non-residential element of the development and achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 2.8 tonnes CO2 equating to 31.3% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the Be Lean case of the Energy Hierarchy.

E) Measures to reduce the carbon dioxide emissions associated with other energy uses not covered by Building Regulations (un-regulated) should be incorporated prior to occupation and maintained in the development in perpetuity as detailed in the Sustainability and Energy Statement Rev 01 (February 2017).
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.

Reason:  To ensure that the non-residential space hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.
| Tree Protection

No operations (including initial site clearance) shall commence on site in connection with development hereby approved until a suitable scheme (Arboricultural Method Statement) for the protection of existing trees, shrubs and hedgerows has been submitted to and its installation on site has been approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

All protection measures must fully detail each phase of the development process taking into account demolition/site clearance works, all construction works and hard and soft landscaping works.  Details shall include the following:

o	Full survey of all trees on site and those within influencing distance on adjacent sites in accordance with BS5837*, with tree works proposals.  All trees must be plotted on a site plan**, clearly and accurately depicting trunk locations, root protection areas and canopy spreads.
o	A plan** detailing all trees, shrubs, hedges planned for retention and removal.
o	Soil assessments/survey
o	Timing and phasing of works
o	Site specific demolition and hard surface removal specifications
o	Site specific construction specifications
o	Access arrangements and car parking
o	Level changes
o	Landscaping proposals

o	A Tree protection plan** in accordance with BS5837* detailing all methods of protection, including but not restricted to: locations of construction exclusion zones, root protection areas, fit for purpose fencing and ground protection, service routes, works access space, material/machinery/waste storage and permanent & temporary hard surfaces.
o	Soil remediation plans.

All tree protection methods detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the  site, unless the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority has first been sought and obtained.
*Using the most recent revision the of the Standard
** Plans must be of a minimum scale of 1:200 (unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority).

Reason: To secure the protection, throughout the time that the development is being carried out, of trees, shrubs and hedges growing within or adjacent to the site which are of amenity value to the area.
| Travel Plan

A detailed Green Travel Plan designed to manage the transport needs of the occupiers of the development, including measures to minimise car useage, promote alternative modes of transport, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority before the first occupation of the development, and the approved green travel plan shall be implemented and complied with the approved document.

Reason: To promote sustainable patterns of transport to safeguard the living and working conditions of local people and in the interest of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with section 4 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2015 and policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026.
| Parking Management Plan

Prior the first occupation of the development, a Parking Management Plan that details the allocation of car parking spaces, on-site parking controls and charges and enforcement of unauthorised parking shall be submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall be implemented before the development permitted is occupied and maintained thereafter.

Reason: In the interest of an appropriate operation of the development in accordance with policies 1.1(e) (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A  of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 6.11, 6.12 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Building Hard/ Soft Landscaping and Boundary Treatment

Details of hard/soft landscape works and boundary treatments shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority before development is commenced and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and residential amenity of prospective occupiers, and in accordance with policies 3.5, 7.4, and 7.21 of the London Plan 2015, policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(b) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework.

| Prior to the first occupation of the approved development two of the approved parking spaces shall be implemented to provide one active electric vehicle charging point and one with passive charging provision.

Reason: In the interest of the environment and improving air quality in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and policies 6.13 and 7.14 of the London Plan (2016).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended) (or any subsequent order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modifications), the ground floor commercial units shall not be subdivided and shall only be used for an A1 Use Class activity, and not for any other use without prior approval of the Local Planning Authority obtained by the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To ensure that the Council retains control over the quality, impacts and provision of any change of use, and to safeguard the vitality and viability of the local shopping parade in accordance with policy 4.7 of the London Plan (2016); policies 1.1(d), 2.7(c) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012); and policy 4C of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013).
| The ground floor retail units hereby approved shall not be opened to customers before 0700 hrs or after 2300 hrs on any day.
Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016).
